problem_text:
Let X, Y be Fitting classes of soluble groups which satisfy the Lockett condition, i. e. X ∩ S∗ = X∗, Y ∩ S∗ = Y∗ where S denotes the Fitting class of all soluble groups and the lower star the bottom group of the Lockett section determined by the given Fitting class. Does X ∩ Y satisfy the Lockett condition?
Editors’ comment (2001): The answer is affirmative if X and Y are local (A. Grytczuk, N. T. Vorob’ev, Tsukuba J. Math., 18, no. 1 (1994), 63–67).
H. Lausch
answer: The answer is affirmative if X and Y are local (A. Grytczuk, N. T. Vorob’ev, Tsukuba J. Math., 18, no. 1 (1994), 63–67).
